newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR WEAKENS UNDER IMPORTER DEMAND.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR WEAKENS UNDER IMPORTER DEMAND.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar was quoted softer on the key U.S. dollar and other hard units on the back of early demand for foreign currency on Thursday morning, dealers said.
"We've just started seeing buyers from the 11.3900 level up to 11.4125. I'm not quite too sure why, but there could be a big import order in the market," commented one dealer.

He said the local unit was trading at 11.4050/4150 against the U.S. dollar around 0810 GMT from Wednesday's close of 11.3850/3950 and was also quoted weaker versus pound sterling at 19.2300/2500 compared to 19.2115/2880.
It was at 6.4700/4900 from 6.4650/4920 against the mark but was a touch firmer against South Africa's rand at 2.5000/5200 from 2.5005/5105.
